physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium: 10.7 to 15.8 mg/dL, Creatinine: 1.7 to 4.3 mg/dL, Phosphorus: 2.7 to 4.0 mg/dL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Persistent hypercalcemia with serum calcium levels between 10.7 to 15.8 mg/dL. Serum creatinine increased from 1.7 mg/dL to 4.3 mg/dL. Serum phosphorus was within normal range at times.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum calcium levels rose from 10.7 mg/dL to 15.8 mg/dL with intervention and later decreased to 10.3 mg/dL on treatment with ketoconazole.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium: 15.8 mg/dL, Creatinine: 4.3 mg/dL, Phosphorus: 3.6 mg/dL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fatigue and confusion; elevated serum calcium.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The serum calcium level rose from 11.5 mg/dL despite prednisone treatment.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium: 15 mg/dL, Creatinine: 2.62 mg/dL, 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D: 75 pg/mL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Low-grade fever and poorly localized pains in back and shoulders, with an erythrocyte sedimentation rate of 110 mm/h.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms did not improve on initial treatment; serum calcium level fluctuated but generally improved with treatment.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Ionized calcium: 5.92 mEq/L (age 53), 24-hour urine calcium levels: 508 mg, 288 mg, 360 mg, normal <300 mg.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal parathyroid glands found during surgeries; low levels of 24,25-dihydroxyvitamin D.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Bone mineral density decreased slightly over 8 years but remained above average at age 73.
